GQuIy3P-GrWRBI8HU-PeNg.text: Great food and service! This place has a simple and quick ordering system. This is one of my favorite fast food restaurants (although I only classify chipotle as fast food because of their quick service,their food is fresh and delicious).  I recently used the online ordering for carry out and it was very easy and saved time by not having to wait in line since I was in a rush. The manager, Amanda, was very friendly and helpful.  I love this restaurant and I would recommend this place to everyone!

HDN8r--7LjCF3C4myAY21A.text: Pretty typical Chipotle... I came here on New Year's Eve. The line was practically out the door, but thankfully it moved pretty quickly. I ordered chips and guacamole to share with my co-worker and a burrito bowl for myself. The chips and guac were very tasty! The guac was good, and the chips were perfectly light, crispy, and salty. However, my burrito bowl was disappointing. There was way too much rice, sour cream, and cheese and too little chicken, salsa, and lettuce.

TEemXXnqA0WcPVWCQ-gZbA.text: So tonight I went to one of my favorite restaurants tonight, only to be disappointed.... when I ordered my food i had to keep asking for more because they were giving only half the portion size.... when I went to check out my friends and I all showed our fire IDs because our previous visit the girl had told us they gave a first responder discount.... this time, however, I am told that because we were volunteer firefighters and not police officers  that we could not get the discount.... I was highly upset wbout this because it seems like the person was saying that because we were all Volunteers and not Paid or in uniforms that we didnt deserve it... in an area that is made up of mostly volunteer firefighters that kind of upset me... I'm not sure if I will be returning or not.

kIM6kJmPXXzLJ-b2X6icWQ.text: This Chipotle was located near our hotel and we decided to have lunch here before heading out to a Pirates game at PNC Park. While crowded the staff kept the line moving and quickly assembled out order. We found the staff friendly and efficient and was eating after a 5-minute wait. The food was good and typical of other Chipolte's, they get you in and get you out quick, and that's what I wanted. When busy the staff seems to let the trash cans over fill and fails to promptly clean tables. During our visit the trash cans were full and their were messy tables throughout the dining area. I will visit this Chipolte again when I am in the area hoping that the messy state of the restaurant was a one time event.

vxg6EaABunPJj9Vx0jPu1Q.text: My fav place to eat. Everything is always fresh!!! This is like my second home! I give it 5 stars because every time I'm here the order is correct and the food is made fast and fresh.

4lc6Dehm5SfUSBLA9-V_7A.text: I was telling someone the other day how I think Chipotle should be one of the five food groups. Yes, I love Chipotle. I have eaten here at least once a week for probably two months...or longer. I love the Subway-esque watch your food while it's being made thing and getting to pick how much of each ingredient gets put in your food. I eat both the bowls and burritos, lately preferring a vegetable bowl with guacamole (guac is free on veggi bowls and burritos!) and a side of chips. Everything is super fresh and I get a delicious meal for around $10.  A go-to place for a quick, cheap, yummy meal.

ky9bab-qSWAs-fcQzFhbBw.text: I hate this chipotle. It's dirty and parking is the worst!  The guacamole was way too salty and the red onion was in huge chunks, also the chicken was defintely on the burnt crunchy and not very good side. This location also has no chips almost every time I go. I find this location to be the absolute most unacceptable chipotle to date. You need to clean up, have a much better trained staff and then maybe I would consider coming back to your location. Other than that stick to literally any other chipotle they are 100 times better than this one. here is my personal message to management. You are pathetic in the way you run this chipotle.

U-Lm2IxqxoFnNUvsrPfSjA.text: SLOWWWW. Always a line at this one no matter the time of day. Management needs to be a leader and motivate the workers.

d45ow_LVIV2AKbBJIKnsCA.text: 6 months ago I bought a chicken burrito here and it contained some unknown substance,  I e-mailed the company and they responded quickly. Sent me fee coupons. I went again this week ordered a steak burrito, it contained  grisely meat with no taste. I think it's time to find somewhere else for burritos.

I0zl65-OR_mGPITf45-3HA.text: I love Chipotle. I could eat here every day. However,  the parking sucks and the line is always way too long. Fast food? Not really.....

F8cAkrCHlUqcDoEL77Q41w.text: This is my favourite restaurant. The food and service is always great. Now that they have gone non GMO I  go here more than anywhere else.

fqJqoHRN_0II1dZFvcaoPA.text: My wife and I have been to Chipotle locations all over the region. As other reviewers have noted, the Chipotle location in West Mifflin is similar to the other Chipotle restaurants in the sense that it looks like a Chipotle restaurant and the menu items are the same. When it comes to the things that matter such as customer service, cleanliness, and taste, the West Mifflin location is severely lacking.   I visit this location when I must as it's closest to my home and work. I've been using the timer on my phone to calculate their average rate of production; 3.5 minutes. Yes, on average, this Chipotle location rings one customer order through the register every 3 1/2 minutes. If you've ever been to the Chipotle in Peters Twp. or Greensburg (which are equally busy), you've noticed that there's hardly ever a line. When a line does build up, the team of employees works together to get the customers taken care of. At the location in West Mifflin, employees are conversing with one another, texting, smoking refreshing cigarettes in back, or just clowining around in the grill area. On the rare occasion that an employee of the West Mifflin location does acknowledge your presence as a customer, the encounter typically won't be positive. Completely unacceptable and utterly frustrating.   The food at the West Mifflin Chipotle location is either absurdly salty or completely bland. Other Chipotle locations seem to be able to maintain consistency. Not West Mifflin. In addition, the steak is typically undercooked and full of gristle with the consistency of bubble gum. Now and then the chicken will be a little on the undercooked side as well. Portion sizes are laughable compared to other Chipotle locations. The iced tea is nearly always empty. Guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and various meats are usually nearly out or completely gone.   Tables, seating areas, and the fountain drink area are usually covered in food, napkins, plasticware, and strawpapers. I typically take a newspaper in with me and lay it down as a table cloth of sorts over top of remanants of the meals left behind by previous customers. Garbage cans are consistently full if not overflowing. Floors are perpetually dirty and somewhat sticky.  I was recently at another Chipotle location in the region that I often drive 30 minutes out of my way to frequent. The manager at the store, who makes it a point to know repeat customers by name, introduced me to some visiting Chipotle brass and explained that I was a frequent flyer there. The big manager thanked me and asked me and asked if I had any input that could be relayed to the home office in terms of improvement. I told him that each and every Chipotle that I visit is top notch with the exception of one: West Mifflin. When I said that, he smiled, giggled under his breath, and said "Yeeeaaah. THAT one..."  If you can make it to any Chipotle location other than West Mifflin, do yourself a favor and do so. If West Mifflin has been your only Chipotle experience, please don't judge the whole chain based on one incompetent location.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The line is 19 people deep. I haven&#39;t moved an inch in 25 minutes.
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Uncooked steak. Really Chipotle?

FfmCo63cZWYm0ZxbJSnUEw.text: Haven't had a real problem here in about 4 years.  Yeah, it gets busy at lunch, but where doesn't?  The food has been decent, the staff very quick, and pride is alright for what you get.  My only gripe is that the dining area could use some more attention.  Ideally, the customers are not cleaning up after the previous patrons.

BQ7G26eEVevU0eVr1p8i0A.text: I have a deep deep love of Mexican food and even though chipotle lacks horchata and doesn't end in bertos it still hits the spot for me.   I have noticed a few times that the rice has been a bit undercooked and the line here can get a bit long but that's about it. I enjoy their guacamole and I almost always go with the barbacoa. It's spice so if that's not your thing then they also have chicken steak or carnitas(pulled pork). Also the corn salsa adds a great contrast to the spice.   Did I mention it's the only Mexican place in the area other then Taco Bell which I feel doesn't really count.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Barbacoa burrito bowl. Mmmmmm
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Early dinner. Mmm

sJ5Km1b7AyxxXLeXltcHRA.text: Slow slow slow. One girl was practically running the store by herself. The other two girls working the line were just in the way. The two cooking were too busy talking to each other to notice what was needed.

v6_TBLvthuI_-8tl2b1rZA.text: Portions are always too small, food is always bland, always busy, and unclean. There are WAY better chipotles to go to, this one sucks.

tRUGQ6OscFJQ_-UOlU-1xQ.text: Chipotle tastes delicious so let's not even argue about that. Like all chipotles it's gets very busy during certain hours however with new online ordering it is much faster and easier. However one time I ordered online and they gave me the wrong meat in my tacos so make sure to check before you leave. Parking lot can be difficult to find a spot in. Staff is mostly pleasant but the restaurant could be cleaner, fruit flies are often by the lemons and I don't like that.

OHC8bgFQr0Ldmg9IR0-JHw.text: They have not improved. I reviewed them a year ago and thought they were better the last two times I came here. Nope! Incompetent management still rules. Stupid, inefficient and less than clean. The restroom smells so bad that you cannot go in there. It smells like the fryers exhaust into the toilets. Anyway, I have no optimism that things will improve after today's experience. Go elsewhere for your burrito!

mMrLomLU-iPkbqpcxwkwAQ.text: You should not go here if you are in a rush or have somewhere to be because you wait in line for about 30 minutes. Terrible! I have never been to a chipotle this slow. I'm shocked people actually come here knowing this. I will not come back. This is my 3rd time coming here and everytime it has been an extremely long wait yet the line takes forever to move! Plus they don't give you as much food as the other chipotles. So irritated right now.   I am actually writing this review as I stand in line.

vhEqtEzUlvsLgWmisX3-Yw.text: Returned the today, for a 45 minute wait for two burritos. If that's what you can call the loosely wrapped oozing blob I received. I didn't get a bowl, so I had no intention of having to use utensils, but this was so ridiculous that a fork was necessary. The line was long, but got up there relatively quickly. Only to stand there, without explanation, while online orders were completed for what felt like a long time (more than a few minutes, think closer to 10). I feel like this is not the best way to go about fulfilling those orders when the restaurant is clearly packed. I also would like to thank whomever for the giant piece of grayish green avocado (I hope) in our guacamole. Not very appetizing. While bacterial illnesses may keep people away, repeatedly poor service and products will be what loses my interest.

h1XT1ObdCBXG_FG88Njfeg.text: I decided to give this a second try, my kid wanted to go to Moe's. Well, I wish would have went to Moe's. I had a steak burrito bowl, wife had a steak salad. Steak was tough and very bland. We feel all of the food was flavorless. One daughter had tacos and said it was ok, and the other had them make a "taco bowl" with tofu.  Service ws very friendly, but food was just not there. Next time will go back to Moe's.

L1pjsLPIY0uVLS5GOrhWaQ.text: Today I got crispy tacos. I chose two with chicken and one with sofritas (tofu).  Very tasty. Service was quick. Dining area was a mess. I haven't seen anyone come out with a broom or something to clean the tables yet and I am about to leave.  But I am full so mission accomplished

Daet6Z4KEGN7_61HuedH1g.text: It's been awhile since I've been to Chipotle because on my last visit the food wasn't good. Hoping it was a one time thing we came back. I wish we had not bothered.  As far as serving size it was a bit ridiculous. I ordered a bowl with chicken. I was given half a spoonful of rice and a half a spoonful of chicken. The lady in line before me asked for more and they charged her for double meat. I asked for sour cream and the employee have me two heaping spoonfuls. My rice and chicken were swimming in it. I also ordered chips and guacamole. The chips didn't have any salt on them and there seemed to be less of those also.  The grossest part was how fatty the chicken was. I had that at my last visit with the pork. All in all it was bad. I definitely won't be back.

n7_Qfp0wTP840FI0XEc-Bg.text: Always love every chipotle I go to except for this one! When you walk in, there is ALWAYS a long line that wraps around the room, takes up too much room, and is slow. The food is always good, but the workers are extremely slow. They are always out of brown rice when I have gone (atleast 3 times) and low on barbacoa. It's just a little ridiculous. The seating is never open, and when there is open seating, it's not cleaned. Only stop here when I actually have no other choice. Not a good individual store. Find the next nearest chipotle to go to. Also, they give you the smallest portion!! I normally can't finish a whole burrito or even close to it, when I go here I always finish the entire burrito and am still hungry. They're stingy and greedy here .

7EWPTphN1CUmVO2uZCaYkQ.text: My husband and I love Chipotle! We frequent the one in Greensburg the most. It is calm, nice music, quick, friendly, clean.. I could go on and on. We were there recently and the line was out of the door and around the building- no problem we waited 25 min- there was plenty of food and the employees were very friendly and just kept working, they stayed calm, the back kitchen was working hard to keep the food fresh and bins full. I state all of this to show the glaring difference at the west mifflin chipotle....  Every time I go to the west mifflin chipotle there is utter chaos... There could be 2 or 20 people in line and the staff is screaming at each other, yelling out for no actual reason, making noise, texting WITH GLOVES ON, running out of food, bumping into each other, never cleaning the place. I was there recently and the girl that was heating the tortillas was so rude to a customer I couldn't believe it. He asked for a burrito and she said oh you want a burger? I guess I could fashion you a burger... He repeated his burrito request and the girl kept going on and on- the MANAGER then jumped in and was laughing and adding to it- the kid was visibly uncomfortable.  Finally another employee told them to knock it off.   I downloaded the chipotle app for this location alone, to hopefully avoid being inside for longer than I have to... I am also afraid to use said app at the west mifflin chipotle for fear the idiots behind the counter won't know what to do.   One star for this location 4 stars for Greensburg, Robinson, and all other locations I'm sure...

m7YxYqaWIlhTQz1Ve_DkSw.text: This is like a Chipotle that's not really a Chipotle. The layout looks familiar, the food choices are the same...  ...but that's where it ends. This is the slowest Chipotle I've ever been to. All three visits have been annoyingly slow. We're talking five people back from the tortilla steamer and it STILL took fifteen minutes to get through the line.  The counter workers had to be corrected repeatedly by those around me. (I.e. "I asked for fajita veggies..." Or "double chicken, remember?" Or my own "could I have more lettuce than that?" when she put about eight shreds on my bowl.)  Even the food lacks. The chips are usually more chewy than crispy, the chicken tastes...different, and the steak chunks were so big my husband had to go get a knife and cup up the pieces.  It's just not worth it. I'd rather drive thirty minutes the other way to McMurray.

Dv4oDBb5Btv61E8d0uhSzA.text: I am not very happy with this particular Chipotle. I've been to this location a handful of times since it is very close to my home. I have tried to order online twice now and both times have been a disaster, especially because I have had two small children with me and the whole point is NOT to wait and be able to go in and get out quickly. The first time I ordered online they completely lost my order and had to go make it when I got there. The manager apologized and even threw in two drinks free of charge for me. That was fine and I was okay with that. The second time, today, though was not cool at all. I was to pick up my order at 11:15. I got there at 11:20 and they apparently hadn't even started on the order. I could have honestly got in line and ordered 20 burritos by the time the girl in the back finished my order. I think she was having a mental breakdown in the back. I understand everyone has bad days but she was running around barely doing anything, dropping several gloves on the floor, and doing everything so so slow. It was frustrating to me to say the least. My children were less than patient because it was past their lunch time. No one apologized or tried to make it right. I got my food at 11:35!! It was 20 minutes PAST the order pick up time and 15 minutes with my small children waiting. You guys need to get it together. I enjoy Chipotle, but this location needs better management and better trained employees. I'm not planning on returning to this place anytime soon and I highly discourage anyone to use their online ordering, especially at this location.

TnwvHOoN9sottRjL2Gucmw.text: Not bad for a chain. They hey through the orders fairly quickly. Nothing spectacular to wrote about. The burrito bowl and salad are pretty much the same. Only difference...the salad has lettuce cut in pieces,  the burrito bowl has shredded lettuce. The guacamole is good. They go a little overboard on the sour cream. Otherwise not to bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cup o&#39; H20
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outside

Mq_WIr1Tmyfk1jmGrd0xGw.text: My wife and I are long-term Chipotle fans. We were first introduced in Akron, OH and then Columbus, OH. We can't wait to get back to these locations.   Tonight there were so many employees on hand we couldn't count. That's not so bad except they were running out of staples like chicken, mild salsa, beans and rice... One worker pulled the empty bean tub and upon returning with a new one stopped to notice how filthy the work station was. No matter, he set the bean tub in its place and kept right on. Then, when I watched as our chicken was cut up, I noticed this work station was dirty too. Nobody cares to clean their work station as they go.  While our food was being prepared, the line backed up at the register because the cashier was standing in the back on his phone. The line workers we're calling for 'Patrick' several times while people's food was getting cold. Seriously? Onto the dining room. Tables were a mess and needed wiped off. Notice the common theme of nobody cleaning. The soda station had straw papers and napkins laying all around and looked like nobody services this area all day and into the evening.  Bottom line, we ate our dinner, but there were too many employees on hand who were bumping into each other out of complete disorganization.

ct28l510lYlVJHc78kQPiQ.text: This is the worst food establishment in the history of the world. My wife and I stopped in for a late night supper on our way back from Pittsburgh. We walked in and found that the sitting area was filthy and floor hadn't been swept in days. The serving size here is minuscule in contrast to our local chipotle. When they gave us such a small serving of rice, I asked for a side to make my meal more filling...the employee proceeded to fill a salsa cup with rice... We then cancelled our order and ate at ChikFila...thanks for nothing chipotle..

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Small serving size
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Very dirty trash area

ZMKVf_rFioiFdUGnsuo82Q.text: Slowest, worst Chipotle at which I have ever eaten. I consistently leave this establishment angry because of how poorly it is run. There are usually only two people on the line (including the cashier) and the rest of the employees are just loitering in the back. The line backs up, even at low volume times, and you will wait 20 minutes no matter when you go. Even if there are sufficient employees working the line, it's slow, because they move in a lackadaisical manner with no sense of urgency or concern for moving people through the line. It's the worst near closing time because all of the employees are doing their clean up jobs and side work and there is only one person serving the clientele. If reviews were based on food alone, this chipotle would probably earn 4 stars, which is the only reason I return. This needs a new manager and an entirely new staff.

UJcxHmvj3ir7jnnvsLqgIQ.text: I absolutely love this place,  amazing service & amazing food. They always have a line but the wait time isnt very long.

bFeWZcmfKbk9k7kKGP6o_g.text: I am confused by the masses of people who religiously go to chipotle. Today was my first visit and most definitely my last visit.  I brought my daughter for dinner around 7:30 on a Sunday. When we walked in there was no line so we went straight to the counter. My first impression was that it isexpensive. $7 dollars for three tacos and it doesn't even come with chips? At that point I normally would of left, but my daughter had a coupon for a free kids meal from her book club, so I figured it would even out the bill.   I was surprised by the lacking menu with only four items to choose from, (Burrito, burrito bowl, tacos, salad). Even worse was the slim pickings of toppings to fill the items on the lacking menu. No raw ingredients like peppers, olives, or onions. As a vegetarian, that left me with few options. Imagine Moe's, but now with way less to choose from, and tastes horrible. I decided to go with the soft tacos filled with beans, rice, lettuce and salsa. (What they call "salsa" is really just very dry pico de gallo.) My daughter got the "build your own taco" meal, which came with fruit. We also got an order of chips and queso.  When we sat down, my daughter opened her fruit, which was covered in mold. (By the way, it was a clemintine in a dressing cup, not peeled. Why they wasted a plastic container for an unpeeled orange is beyond me.) I took it back up to the counter and was given a small bag of chips instead. Both hers and mine chips were stale. So stale that they didnt even crunch or break, they were chewy. I took the chips back three times to exchange before just asking if I could return them. At that point they ended up refunding me back to my bank card. They didnt even seem to be phased and said the chips go stale often. Along with the stale chips and moldy fruit, nothing else was good either. The tacos were way too dry and tasted strange. My daughter also thought her meal tasted bad too, without me saying anything about mine. We ended up throwing everything away and going to Wendy's.  On top of it all the restuarant was filthy! Every single table in the place was dirty, and they were far from busy. The floor was so sticky that my flip flops were getting stuck to it. I'm not sure who out there loves chipotle, but it surely is not me.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie tacos

Lr_Ar3eBRiNf5j4FPJikGQ.text: Placed a order for pickup fo 4, 4:15 and the order still isn't ready. Why order ahead at this place. Still here at 4:30 waiting for the steak to get cooked

3pWy6sgYX9eROf7OnFGBQw.text: I give this one star it's the worst chipotle ever they are  rude and the guacamole is black, They are not clean at all first and last time coming to this place I don't recommend this place, really disappointed.

yP34xBxYBYd8VjUNTYQ1ZA.text: Disappointing night here. It's not even 9 pm and they are out of veggies.... quac.. black beans ... and the staff is mite interested in cleaning .... usually this is a good place to go but how can you be out of so much and not offer to make anything for the customers u have coming in.

eQ1Ym-fuZwgNjWHqSIpkFg.text: I seriously don't know WHY I continue to spend my money at this specific chipotle, maybe because of the convenience. But after tonight. I'm not. The overall service here is terrible. Especially the quality of food. I'm eaten at pretty much all the chipotles in the Pittsburgh area and this one just doesn't make the cut. I'm not sure if they're using different seasonings or no seasonings at all. But the every time I come here, and get the SAME thing it taste different!! The staff tonight was rude, and all over the place. Overall it was a waste of money, waste of gas, and waste of time.

4PnNGIHWXNszGQLnf9wHng.text: The service here is extremely slow.  No matter the time or day the line is always 10 to 15 people deep.  The online orders are typical late as well.   Portioning is very inconsistent trip to trip.   The staff shows little interest in moving the line along any faster.  Far and away the worst Chipotle I've experienced.

txCy2QzTJYmZrIu19I_eJQ.text: I like chipotle. I however do not like this chipotle. The workers here need a hard reality check. I went in with my son. Line was long we were okay just chatting and enjoying some time together. When we go up to order it went down hill quick! The guy who takes your order was so rude and gross. He was picking chicken up with his hands. There were utensils available but he did not use them. I spoke up when it was time for mine. I asked him not use his hands. He got smart with me and said I have gloves on. I told him I didn't care that I just watched him touch unsanitary handles. He seriously rolled his eyes and grabbed a little plastic container that they use for there salsa. He threw it away after he was done against the wall where the trash was looked at me and said next. I was like whoa wait he wouldn't  acknowledge me. I moved on the next area where the girl there was just as nasty. She used her hands to put cheese on my bowl. I guess it's just their thing there. But for real I watched them touch a pen, the register and the cooler with the same gloves they touch my food. Perhaps I'm just picky or whatever but I'm not going back. They are dirty in there. Not to mention slow as hell. Half of the workers look high. I'll stick to my own chicken bowls.

DokzkIhQAmFSg-xQM4kpBQ.text: I have had probably over 100 chipotle experiences. Today's was the worst ever!!!  Since the country is in the middle of a romaine lettuce E. coli crisis , not a leaf of lettuce to be found!  I guess they don't think to use a little spring mix, or even chopped ice berg to substitute.  I got my usual burrito bowl. Black beans, fajitas (they were so overlooked that they were no longer green and white but brown and mushy! ). The rice, which I don't get, was stuck together and so starchy- not the usual glistening looking rice that I have come to want!  One spoon of chicken, and well even with all four salsas...and a smidge of sour cream...the bowl was pathetically half full (no lettuce remember). I am kicking myself that the shock of it all prevented me from taking a picture to show you!  This is what happens to chain restaurants, they decline, decline, decline!  Even the fresh salsa was flavorless...maybe the cilantro was on e coli watch as well??  Did I mention the place was just overall dirty?  The tables, the floors....oh my!  You Chipotle at this location will never get another dime from this gal. Thanks but no thanks!  If you told me my first one star review would be for one of my go to places for the longest time, I wouldn't even believe you!!  YUCK!

F9MtjXvY_mRgTSRHIdj6Zw.text: Every SINGLE time I come here they are out of something. Last week it was guac, which me getting the veggie bowl guac is the main course because it's free. The week before that no black beans in sight. And yesterday I went to the register to ask for chips and getting told the chips are all free today because they're stale. Go figure. After receiving very little scoops of black beans and rice after I asked for 2 scoops because the workers are always slow and chincy on the food for whatever reason. I feel like i'm ruining their whole day when i ask for more rice god forbid. I'll stick to Chick Fil A up the street for now on or travel out of my way to go to the other Chipotle.

wDyUXCARad6hY1ZrzCBmlA.text: I always enjoy going to Chipotle, but this location is always hit or miss. You never know what quality of food you are going to get that day. Some days it's really good and spot on! Some days, it's not so good. One thing they never can get consistent here is the vinaigrette dressing. Most of the time, I find that it doesn't meet the same quality that I would get at other Chipotle locations. There have been numerous times where the rice hasn't been cooked correctly, and when the rice isn't cooked correctly, it just ruins the whole meal.   I know it has nothing to do with this location specifically but Chipotle needs to bring back the Chorizo. The flavors complimented the other ingredients perfectly! Sacrificing the Chorizo in order to introduce the Queso was definitely a bad move! The queso texture is too grainy and is not up to Chipotle quality.

gQJjxrXPXEg3UhEbwvWoXw.text: Seems to be your standard Chipotle.  Line was short but no tables available at dinner at 7:15 on a Tuesday so we did take out.  All of our servings seemed to be rather standard except my burrito seem a tad bigger than usual.  Staff was OK and did communicate in a nice way but not overly friendly.

Vk9V0dP1mWJHVQo-VPPmUg.text: Awful... made me sick to my stomach and service was awful... will never waste money here again

RRemEdgGKBtNJ8nkbEq0mw.text: If you are celiac or gluten free go elsewhere. This location will not take care of you! They will not get anything from the back and they offered to change the spoons but never took the old one out! We love chipotle I just wish I could find one that understands, no meal is worth spending the night in the hospital! Disappointed

B6eCHgFXkYvq-0op--uHsw.text: Terrible service and workers. Always a line when I come in even though no one was is actually sitting down..1 person working the line and register while other employees stand around and talk..better off going to local grocery store and making it yourself

Zmcqf9AlCd8ayfLPJ9KDTw.text: So disappointed. All I get are 3 tacos with cheese, lettuce, chicken and pico on the side. I got it to go. I get home to discover they forgot my pico, one of 3 ingredients I asked for. My soft shells tasted SO OLD. They were crumbling apart like a hard shell. Not even remotely soft or fresh. My husband who eats everything wouldn't even eat it.  This chipotle seems to get it right about 2 times out of 10.

nneh7G5_SsI26QTjJAhWYQ.text: I think chipotle can be a healthier alternative to other fast food chains if you choose right.  Get pretty busy around lunch time but service is very fast.   Choose from burritos, tacos, bowls with chicken, pork or beef. Sofritas are new (tofu).   Good for fast food in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie bowl, side of guac, chips

4jEYy65u_JPrG-sPr8xm7g.text: Like in previous reviews it's hit or miss, the reason it finally brought me to wright a review was the poor treatment I received, my wife son and I frequent here easily once a week. Today the burrito "artist" for lack of a better title, when asked to not put the last remaining bit of old soggy fajita on my burrito when they were handing her fresh, she ignored me and piled it high, then from there grabbed one more from the new, creating a monstrosity. I said "please start fresh I don't want that" and she said "that's protocol" then when I persisted she threw it out. Meanwhile the line is getting longer and making me and my family look like the cause, there was no line when we showed up. So onto the "replacement burrito, now I receive next to no rice before she hands it off to the next person, and I was grateful for a new person to help me resurrect this lifeless burrito. So I go through getting all the normal. We get our booth and everything's sweet until I bite into mine and find that I forgot the sour cream, no big deal that's my bad. I head back up to the register to request a side of sour cream, she was off to the side and didn't hear it was me that asked for it. Went to hand it nicely to the lady cashing out. "Not for me" the lady said, I said "it's for me" and she practically tossed it to me when I went to get it from her.... it's sad the treatment you can receive for simple being hungry. I did nothing anyone else wouldn't have done.  So now I've figured my family once a week eats here through the hit or miss quality of the food. That's easily over 1,000 a year to a burrito joint. Please fix this Chipotle we love you!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

mn8WvWcEia2F0vff3qVC4Q.text: This Chipotle is not a Chipotle.  Upon entering I couldn't decide if I'd just missed a giant food fight or if the cleaning crew had gone on strike for a month. It was up for debate since the floor was littered with trash and the tables were covered with food remains. I was shocked. Secretly, I convinced myself it was just a product of a dinner rush.   There was only a short line, yet it was barely moving. The longer-than-usual wait, allowed me to make further observations of the chain. It was hard not to notice the dirty 'white' walls, grimy from grubby hands rubbing against them. The windows hadn't been washed. The trash was overflowing. There was an employee that appeared to be in charge of cleaning, but was only walking around looking dazed and confused. He did have a spray bottle in one hand and a towel in the other. I really wanted to explain how the 'trigger' on the spray bottle worked. But my growling stomach convinced me to stay in line.  When it was my turn to order, I was met by a less than enthusiastic girl. She never cracked a smile and was moving like a sloth. Either she possessed no personality or was stoned. It was actually the main topic of discussion during our meal. The rest of the crew (4 young females) were a touch better... but slow and inefficient. Two of the girls served no purpose on the assembly line whatsoever. The 'burrito wrapper' mutilated one member of my parties burrito and the 'cash register' girl apologized for the 'meat and rice' girl's attitude toward the woman in front of me. So I apparently missed some drama while I was drooling over the thought of my steak bowl.  My party of four crammed into a booth and devoured our food. The general consensus was the food wasn't as fresh as usual or consistent with other Chipotle experiences. Personally I think it was just the ambiance throwing everything off. The place was so dirty I decided to wash my hands before we left. BIG mistake!! The women's restroom was the filthiest I've ever seen. I'll spare you the details... but keep in mind, I was returning from a 13 hour road-trip from North Carolina... so I'd seen my fair share of disgusting restrooms already that day.  I love Chipotle. I eat there often. But this particular location is just a revolting mockery of one of the best fast-food chains I've come to know. It breaks my heart to admit this but my desire for a burrito bowl has diminished greatly since eating here. Hopefully in time I can recover. This restaurant is not the delicious, quick, and clean dining place that the Chipotle brand represents. I have higher expectations at a Taco Bell.   Shame on you Chipotle on Clairton Boulevard, shame on you!

h6n6fNOgvVJNLycIJQ47gw.text: I roll joints bigger than the fucking burrito they just dished out to me. It's poorly wrapped, the chicken fucking sucks, and they charged me for a fucking water cup. The workers are all gross and seem to have joy in fucking people's day up by giving everyone that steps through those doors the worst meal possible. I honestly hope this place blows up along with the fucking fat asses that work there. This chipotle sucked so bad that it inspired me to redownload yelp just to shit on this place. I literally couldn't have had a worse experience here, so if you do dare to ever come here make sure you bring someone you fucking hate.
